moves.1. d4 f5 2. Bf4 Nf6 3. Nf3 e6 4. Nbd2 g6: This is an almost thematic move against the Dutch. h5 is in sight.
moves.6... Nc6 7. Be2: I need to threat BxN after h5.
moves.7... b6 8. Nc4: Aiming to e5. Black can defend with d6, but this seems to be uncoherent with the Bb7 plan.
moves.8... Nd5 9. Bg5 Nde7: Better would have been Bc6. This keeps the knight pinned.
moves.10... d5: hxg6 is ok, but I have a good grimp on black's position with...
moves.11. h6 Bf8 12. Bf6 Rg8: Now, I want to place a knight on g5, aiming to h7. For some reason I didn't do it just now. (you know, blitz...)
moves.13. Nce5 Qd6 14. a4: Dreaming of supporting the bishop on b5 as for some trick pinning the king.
moves.15... Nxe5 16. Bxe5: Black overlooks Qb4+, Qd2, Qxb2, o-o but probably he feared a rook trap with Bxc7 and Bb7.
moves.20. Nxh7: ...and after Nc6, black cannot stop the pawn without losing a piece. Apart from this, a5 is a strong attack, once prepared.
